head.title: When Psychiatrists Try to Play Judge

hedline.hl1: When Psychiatrists Try to Play Judge

abstract.p: Prof Maynard V Olson letter scores ideologically driven cohort of psychiatrists and other experts who have devoted themselves to creating and validating claims of sexual abuse (July 10 article)

block.p: ''Recanting a Sex Abuse Charge'' (news article, July 10) describes the agony and resilience of a family struggling to renew itself after a young woman accused her father of sexually abusing her and then recanted the accusation.

''Recanting a Sex Abuse Charge'' (news article, July 10) describes the agony and resilience of a family struggling to renew itself after a young woman accused her father of sexually abusing her and then recanted the accusation.

It will be up to the Rockland County District Attorney and the presiding judge to handle the legal complexities. I hope they will find more knowledgeable experts than Rockland County's chief forensic psychiatrist, who claims that the way to distinguish between false and authentic recantations is to analyze the depth of detail of the accusations.

In contrast, a working group on child sexual abuse of England's Royal College of Psychiatrists has concluded that ''there is no reliable means of distinguishing a true memory from an illusory one other than by external confirmation.''

It is time for the news media to examine the culpability of an ideologically driven cohort of psychologists, psychiatrists and social workers who have devoted themselves to creating and validating claims of sexual abuse.
The writer is a professor of medicine at the University of Washington.
